Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is grey-black in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a self-slip, painted with a buff-coloured ground and red and black horizontal bands, traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink survive.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394750) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394750)
